full_threads.body:
Hi Heath

I still haven’t had time to upload these to the website so I might have to request that you do this. I remember you said there was a particular email address for this to go to?

Would you mind sending me the details so we can get these loaded onto the website.

I have 2 machines. This one and a John Deere

Thanks !

Peta

From: Marketing | RAM Equipment
Sent: Tuesday, 20 October 2020 2:06 PM
To: 'Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ' <heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>>
Subject: FW: SK200

Hi Heath

I hope you are having a good week so far.

I need to upload some brochures onto our website. Would you have some time tomorrow to take me through this process – anytime between 11am-2pm? Once I know exactly how to do it I will then be fine going forward (unless we have time available).

I will get the rental pricing from Michael.

Also- we need to update some pictures of staff on website (ie. Myself and two others and take jess down). I might ask for your help with this too so I know how to do going forward.

Thanks!

Peta St Clair

From: Ben Wright | RAM Equipment
Sent: Friday, 16 October 2020 9:11 AM
To: Marketing | RAM Equipment <marketing@ramequipment.com.au <mailto:marketing@ramequipment.com.au>>
Cc: Kevin Grace | RAM Equipment <kevin.grace@ramequipment.com.au <mailto:kevin.grace@ramequipment.com.au>>; Michael Grace | RAM Equipment <michael.grace@ramequipment.com.au <mailto:michael.grace@ramequipment.com.au>>
Subject: RE: SK200

Hi Peta,

I missed you the other day to discuss, here is some ideas for info.

Attached is the Brochure for reference – I have saved on the RAM Server in usual spot (See below)
Link to Kobelco website is: https://www.kobelco.com.au/product-detail/223/sk200-10 <https://www.kobelco.com.au/product-detail/223/sk200-10>
Great 4 minute video on the website – maybe create a link on our website.
Attached is a comparison for SK235SR-2 and the SK200 for reference.
I suggest use the Spec sheet on SK235SR-2 and modify for SK200 as it’s a similar spec, just no blade and larger counterweight (tail).
Photos of machine attached

Moving forward:
Update the website (Hire $$ rates see Michael for Website rates)
Typically we put across all media. (Insta, Facebook, LinkedIn etc)
Commissioning story for machine (typically when new asset rolls up
Expanding hire fleet story (RAM has expanded hire fleet for conventional excavator (ie no blade and standard counterweight), typically RAM Spec as been front dozer blade and reduced radius counterweight (short tail)
Site photo story (follow up story on machine being used onsite – show casing the main benefits (ie steel tracks, well balance (ie standard counter weight), great break-out capacity (ie stronger more powerful in bulk dig out applications), tilt lines factory fitted (great for tilt buckets and rotation attachments, such as rotating grabs and rotating cutter crusher etc.







Hope this info helps.

Cheers




Kind Regards,

Ben Wright
OPERATIONS MANAGER
